answers.answer: bump
It should be routine unless you're having an anatomy scan.
What's that?
Is it the one where they measure the babys head like a deep ultrasound?  Cause if it is i already had that.

Yes that's what the anatomy scan is. I had an appointment at 22 weeks and they just checked weight/ urine sample like usual. Your doc might talk to you about the gestational diabetes test that you'll most likely have next visit. I'm 25 weeks and having mine in a week and a half. They also might tell you about transitioning from every month to every two weeks which is happening for me when I reach 28 weeks
They supposed to tell youI'm 21 weeks also and I have an appointment on Tuesday and they gonna tell me the gender and his size
Bump
Ok thank you. And around how many weeks do i need to have so they start checking me dowb there? That's what im most afraid of. And i alreadt had a pap smear my first visit, do i have another one?
Bump
I actually don't remember when they start checking down there (this is my second pregnancy) I'm a little afraid of that as well.
Around 36 weeks.. depends on your doctor tho
No they won't Do another pap smear
They start checking you around 36 weeks for dilation and effacement. I'm not looking forward to it either but its very important.

They start checking you around 36 weeks usually. They'll have to do your group b strep test around that time which is similar to a pap smear. Group b strep is a bacteria that is normal in the vagina, but has potential to be harmful to the baby during delivery. If you're positive they'll just put you on IV antibiotics for delivery and it lowers the risk to 1 in 1000. My appointments from 20 weeks until 36 weeks consisted of a urine sample, weight check, BP check, dipper checking the heartbeat, and using a tape measurer on my belly to check how big my uterus was. Between 24 and 28 weeks they should have you do your glucose tolerance test where they check for gestational diabetes.

They start checking around 36 weeks. But you can ask them not to its actually not necessary and a lot of doctors don't do it. No you won't get another pap but you will get a strep b testing which is a good idea to do but after than you can opt out of not getting checked down there.
Mine was normal routine checkup, listened to the babys heartbeat again. I have my 25 week appt wednesday and im nervous cause im afraid shes gonna have me take the glucose test :/
And how is that test done?

The glucose test involes drinking a glucose drink they have (mine's called glucola) and drawing blood.takes about an hour, if you don't pasd it ends up being a three hour long process. They usually do them between 27/30 weeks from what I've heard, Im getting mine done at 27 weeks.
I have an appt tomorrow too!  I'll be 20 weeks Saturday!  I hope they give me my appt for my anatomy scan tomorrow because I'm ready to see my baby!
Nope won't have to have another pap smear,  but most doctors do one at 6week post to make sure everything went back to the way it was.

question: So i have a doctor's appointment tomorrow and im 21 weeks, does anyone know if it's a regular appointment?
title: I hate doctor's appointments.
